content:
I was working on replacing the presence dot with the zulip-bot icon when Alya Abbott suggested fixing the opacity of the group-icon and bot-icon in pm-list. However, for all the icons in the left-sidebar, we use an opacity of 0.7px, except for the presence dot. Should we apply the opacity to the presence dot as well? I have pushed the changes with the implementation of this, and will revert it if it is not required.

  • Before:

Screenshot-from-2023-04-18-04-46-35.png

  • New:

Screenshot-from-2023-04-18-04-42-38.png
In the "new" version, the green disk looks much too dim â€” it looks like it's saying it's deactivated or disabled in some way.
Sure, then I will revert the opacity for the presence icon. Thank you for the feedback! :)

Yeah, just for context, the reason we're using opacity 0.7 for those icons in the sidebar is to make them display in a grey in a way that doesn't require manual work to look ok in both the light and dark themes.
The purpose is not to make them look faded -- it's just a mechanism to generate a grey so that they're not bright white/black, which would be quite distracting.
So applying that mechanism to other colors that were picked specifically doesn't make sense.
